website_summaries.verdict: Yamaha's RX-V475 is a great-sounding 5.1 receiver and a good value, although competitors offer better features and design.
pros: The Yamaha RX-V475 offered the best sound quality in our subjective AV receiver listening tests
Its feature set is also decent for the price, with five HDMI inputs (including an MHL-compatible input), built-in AirPlay, and basic networking functionality via its Ethernet port
cons: Some similarly priced receivers offer six HDMI inputs
The RX-V475 also has some confusing design choices, including an indecipherable remote and poorly laid out back panel
And the RX-V475's bulky design is hard to overlook when Marantz's NR1403 is nearly half the size

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the Next Gen of Receivers!
customer_reviews.text: Been using for several years. Overall I'm very pleased with the purchase / functionality. Seems to have everything I want with the ability to control with my iPhone via Airplay and remote app. If you're having issues it is most likely user error or a setting that needs to be tweaked on your TV, network or streaming device. My favorite features are that it automatically turns on when I airplay to it and the ability to easily switch between ATV, Chromecast, etc. It'd earn 5-stars if it had a built-in digital TV converter as there's no co-axial option for me to plug antennae cable into. Otherwise it has been great!
customer_reviews.author: tootallkygy

customer_reviews.title: Love this Receiver. A+
customer_reviews.text: What a great receiver. Sound is very impressive. Loaded with features. The Iphone/Ipad app works perfect all the time. I hooked this reciever to a wireless access point. It shows up on my network the first time I turned it on and has worked flawlessly every time since. Streaming music from my iphone directly tot he receiver works perfect. Plus from the iphone app I can control almost every feature on this reciever. It is jam packed with abilities. I am buying another one because I am so impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shmo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Not an audiophile, but have owned a few stereos in my life so.... this thing is AMAZING !!! Never new my Bose speakers could sound this good. I replaced my 15yr old JVC with this and I keep discovering features this has that truly put me in awe. The iPhone app controller, Airplay, streaming Internet radio, etc... and the system that it uses to calibrate your system for optimal sound is truly impressive. Watched "Transformers: Dark Side of the Moon" in 5.1 surround...... Oh.... My... God !!! Price was terrific. I got it for $300. Sears has it for $550. worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: E. Hiney

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, good power, easy to connect, remote is easy to use also, I love it. I'm not a sound master like most people on here apparently, so I cant tell you technical things, but I will say I'm very picky about my sound and speakers, bass/treble, etc. but Finally after over a decade and 3 different set ups, I have my "home theater" sound like a theater. I can't even turn the sound up all the way, I get about 75% and it's super loud, crisp, and clear! I highly recommend for the average person that wants to play video games or watch movies and feel like your in it.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best home theater sound ever!
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this brief. I love this receiver. Was looking to update to a receiver with HDMI inputs replacing an out dated pioneer. Didn't think the audio could get much better but boy was I surprised. Paired this unit with a set of Klipsh speakers and an existing Yamaha sub, used the included auto setup mic and was ready in minutes. Put in a blue Ray DVD and hit play. I was blown away! Now it truly feels like a theater. Would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Barley

customer_reviews.title: Great features, great sound
customer_reviews.text: I haven't purchased a new AV Receiver in 10 years, but I've previously owned Onkyo, Harman Kardon and Denon. I finally had to upgrade and get full HDMI support. This is my first Yamaha. No complaints at all. OSD is great. The remote works perfectly and handles my other devices without issue. Sounds is great. If I have to buy another receiver in 10 years it will likely be a Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: jdastrup

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This is a top notch receiver for people on a budget. Add a wireless bridge ($20) for net options like Pandora, stream from your computer, or choose from hundreds of pre-set Internet radio stations. The A/B channel switching is simple and comes in handy when I'm in the backyard and want to blast tunes back there instead of in my living room. Great receiver, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: buffhawk84

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pretty big fan of Yamaha receivers. They are focused on sound quality, quality, and simplicity. The look is a tad boring, but my Yamahas are all still in service. Haven't had the same experience with Pioneer brand receivers. I love other products from Pioneer, but had a lot of bad luck with sound quality and service life of their receivers.
customer_reviews.author: DetroitJake

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V575 Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I did not have any intentions of buying another receiver any time soon, but I am glad I made this purchase. Once I became more familiar with its' functionality I appreciated making the purchase of this unit after all. I just love the way it sounds, and internet radio I am liking more and more. This unit I would definitely recommend this to many of my music, radio & TV watching friends.
customer_reviews.author: TheBlackKnight007

customer_reviews.title: Good stereo
customer_reviews.text: Failed under warranty .Had to pay to ship to repair center.No local servicer would honor warranty because I didnt buy it from them.
customer_reviews.author: john moyer

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Overall very happy with the purchase. If I were to do it again, I would have upgraded to the one with two true zones instead of shared. I installed speakers out on the patio and in the living room, so it's nice being able to turn one zone on and the other off or vice versa, but you're forced to use the same input and it's difficult to put them on separate volumes.
customer_reviews.author: kparrent

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and great customer support
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor spent over 4K on his sound system and when visited my house thought that I spent the same amount. Mine was A LOT less. You just can't go wrong with Yamaha when it comes to sound. My original in the basement still works and I had it for over 10 years. Excellent product and great customer support.
customer_reviews.author: user2306

customer_reviews.title: Not good, and not happy
customer_reviews.text: Had this receiver for 1.5 years and lost the SBR channel. Found it set to 1 back rear, so I changed it to 2 back rear thinking awsome, that was the problem. But no, still didn't get signal. Continuity check lines too and tried another speaker. So only conclusion is the channel is fried. Not good, and not happy. Won't be back to Yamaha again. Too many good companies out there so they only get one chance with me. Has to work well and long, or I'm gone - period...
customer_reviews.author: Scott Vadner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and great sound. The microphone Yamaha provides with the receiver makes setting up your surround sound a breeze. My older Yamaha receiver needed a new home, so I purchased this one and got rid of TONS of cables. Now everything is on HDMI and the sound and picture quality is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound of this amplifier is simply spectacular. Perhaps a little bulky and old fashioned with the interactive menu. As usual, it’s very important to study the owner’s manual to understand/exploit all available features and enhancements. Took a little time to get used to the remote control. Good replacement for my venerable Onkyo.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Simón Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: After much research, purchased the RX-V575 and have been extremely satisfied with the unit. Using it as an AVR for outdoor TV & audio and it works and sounds wonderful. Am looking to purchase another higher end Yamaha AVR for the theater room.
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver to replace a Sony 5.1 receiver that I had nothing but trouble with. I have been using it for about a year now and no problems at all. Works great in my great room. Offers good sound quality and easy set up
customer_reviews.author: K. Wellmeier

customer_reviews.title: Rather disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: Rather disappointed.... I read that this unit was an open box purchase that had all pieces in it. When I received the package and open the box it's missing the microphone that's needed for set up, and the FM cable. Bad advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Breen

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly superb
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Yamaha receiver the first was a RX-V2700 that I still have and I love it. This one does not offer as many bells or whistles but for the price this is an excellent buy. You will not be disappointed in taking a chance with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Florence

customer_reviews.title: The previous ONKYO WHICH BIT THE DUST sounded cleaner but Love the features such as internet radio
customer_reviews.text: OK with purchase. The previous ONKYO WHICH BIT THE DUST sounded cleaner but Love the features such as internet radio, connections for ipad (Pandora radio) that this unit provides. Yamaha does NOT GENERATE THE HEAT THAT ONKYO DOES so I hope its with me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Aydelott

customer_reviews.title: Makes a nice entrance
customer_reviews.text: With Airplay and network standby enabled on this guy, I can step up to my front door, queue up Bell Biv Devo's "Poison" and make a proper entrance into my house, with a shuffle and a slide. This unit is replacing my previous Yamaha, so it integrated into my home theater without any issue. Since Yamaha re-used the same IR codes as my last Yammy, I just had to plug it in, run YPAO, and it was just working. Sounds great. My only regret is that, since I only have a 5.1 setup, I could have gotten the V475 for $50 less, but that's hindsight.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Metzler

customer_reviews.title: Audio for all my devices
customer_reviews.text: This was on sale at Amazon and it was a reputable brand. Easy enough to hook up. I have Polk side and center speakers and Klipsch.side surround, and a powered subwoofer. I am not an audiophile, but the sound is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No wonder why they discontinued it
customer_reviews.text: no wonder why they discontinued it it worked for a month then needed repair,new output amps. worked for another 2 months same thing they wouldn't fix it this time. Yamaha you should be ashamed of yourselves.Would not buy Yamaha again.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: but it's still a great upgrade for the HDMI ports
customer_reviews.text: I have glitches with the HDMI, but I think it might be the cable. It could use a bit more features since it lacks some from my original Yamaha receiver, but it's still a great upgrade for the HDMI ports.
customer_reviews.author: Silena Buckelew

customer_reviews.title: We bought this for part of our new sound system ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for part of our new sound system. We had speakers installed in the ceilings of our new home. This receiver was just what we needed. We are able to play it on our lanai or indoors or both.
customer_reviews.author: patricia torchia

customer_reviews.title: What a buy...........
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 5 year old Onyko. Much has improved in 5 years and It was "deal of the day"....great buy and doing all that is was supposed to and more.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Heat

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sound is missing depth, comparing to my old onkyo amp..
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Really great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several AV receivers over the years from top of the line Dennon to cheap ones. This has outstanding quality with top of the line features at a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great reciever
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad, he loves it. Plays in 5.1 which is what he was looking for, has network connections, 3D passthrough and is 4k ready so it will be with him for a long time which is great as he really does not like to replace tech items very frequently
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Zarb

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for our pool room
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound Excellent connection Airplay - To be used with iPhone's and connect to the receiver to play music wirelessly
customer_reviews.author: Troublemaakerz

customer_reviews.title: Nice receiver with excellent app
customer_reviews.text: Nice receiver with an excellent app to control from both Iphone and Ipad (at the same time if you want). Nice dual zone speaker control. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Scientific Design

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V575 7.2 channel reciever
customer_reviews.text: Powerful reciever fits my surround sound system very well. Runs 5 speakers and subwoofer. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Glen M. Ginsburg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint (and its not a fair complaint, since I knew it before ordering) is that wifi isn't built in, but requires a separate dongle.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed and it's amazing!! Sound quality is perfect, easy to use good design and not that big as per its potential!! Fully recommend
customer_reviews.author: ronaldo schwarz art

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha rxv.575
customer_reviews.text: Bought the receiver for the dual zone & Bluetooth capability. Performed great for the first three weeks, then one day it went into overload protection; Would not work after that. Contacted tech support to troubleshoot it, but best option at time was to return item.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Herschap

customer_reviews.title: ... for about 2 years now and it always works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this receiver for about 2 years now and it always works great!
customer_reviews.author: Tom abides

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver. Worth the money. Received it in only two days. Met my needs and a lot more its does a lot of things.
customer_reviews.author: Dante Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, high quality product! Nothing beats a Yamaha! Sound quality output is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Roy P.

customer_reviews.title: DOA!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in March 2014, and as I was in the process of moving to a new house, I didn't open it right away. Well as luck would have it, the return period had already passed by the time I set it up and found it was dead on arrival. I am stuck with a very expensive paper weight... If you take a chance and buy this, don't make the same mistake I did!! Open it right away and check it out...
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Onkyo with HDMI issues
customer_reviews.text: Nice receiver. I bought it as I use it for back yard music on zone 2. I bit of a pain to get zone 2 working with zone 1 on but its still new to me. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver for the money
customer_reviews.text: the app for this stereo is outstanding! You can turn the power on and off and control most features. Excellent receiver for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Wojo66

customer_reviews.title: Back porch speakers and indoor theater
customer_reviews.text: Super price and performance replaced an older demon unit and did it well really happy works of my iPad and makes my life so much easier
customer_reviews.author: sllady

customer_reviews.title: A software upgrade would make this item awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I wanted. A software upgrade would make this item awesome.
customer_reviews.author: scott graves

customer_reviews.title: Poor reliability, poor support
customer_reviews.text: Recover worked for about a year but will not longer turn on. It should be under warranty but Yamaha phone support is terrible and I have been on hold for 15+ minutes with an automated message telling me that my call is very important... The support person directed me to a repair center to call. Poor reliability and poor support. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Woks good the first time I connected. The controls are very sensitive..otherwise works great. Would recommend this to any one, but not the ultimate one.
customer_reviews.author: Manivasagam Sivaraman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Excellent Hub for TV-related Electronics
customer_reviews.text: The 4 HDMI ports and Airplay makes this item a powerful hub for TV-related electronics. The unit is beautiful and, so far, reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar R.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: everything is great but volume on remote does not function
customer_reviews.author: Tom F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Love the internet radio. Easy to follow menus. Plenty of power. Can't imagine what more you would need.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Stampley

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, pathetic setup guidance.
customer_reviews.text: Basic setup is no more complicated than with any A/V receiver and the sound is great. Setting up the rest of the receiver so that functions like separate zone speakers, on-screen programming, Airplay, HDMI and the like is nightmarish. The instructions are not very helpful and there are maddening gaps in getting the setups to register, much less work. I am no novice to home theater and audio and A/V setup. But Yamaha's support and instructions for this otherwise very good piece is pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Good receiver
customer_reviews.text: meets my needs, this receiver is worth every penny if you are looking for something that's not super expensive and that's got a lot of the features of the big boys you can't go wrong with this receiver
customer_reviews.author: Marco Garcia

customer_reviews.title: VERY RECEIVER-y
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, 2 days after I received it, I got into a car accident and totalled my car. I didn't even get a chance to use it. I sent the receiver back the following Monday because I didn't know if I'd need the extra money for anything. BUT IT SURE AS HELL LOOKED REAL PRETTY SITTING IN THE BOX WHILE I HAD IT!
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Great budget reciever!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this reciever for a few months now. It replaced a Marantz that I had had for a few years that was giving me trouble. So far I'm very pleased with this reciever. It has worked flawlessly and sounds great. Setup was super easy too!
customer_reviews.author: curt summers

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Receiver has even more features than I expected. It has great sound and loads of options!!! More than enough power.
customer_reviews.author: pat stacey

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Best receiver I have ever purchase, everything I expected and more, great product. Easy hook and sounds great. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Powe

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Got it for 45% off. Didn't need 7.2, but it was cheaper the 5.2 version while it was on sale. A bit complicated and confusing remote, but got the basic set up done fairly quickly. Sounds great with my JBL speakers and Polk Audio sub woofer.
customer_reviews.author: NJSteve

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Pro- Airplay works great. Simple to set up. Sounds great. Con- Sometimes will flicker, usually shortly after being turned on. Overall it is a great receiver. It has definitely helped cleaned up behind my TV because I can plug everything into the receiver. I highly recommend getting the app for your phone or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: bvanfos

customer_reviews.title: totally awesome
customer_reviews.text: awesome receiver build quality is second to none .the clarity is just amazing and this is not even a top level entry
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is non existent.
customer_reviews.text: We could not get the Zone B speakers to operate separately from the main surround sound set of speakers. The customer service # is a joke, 45 minutes on hold and then we just gave up. They won't publish a working email address to contact customer service. Very frustrating company to try to deal with. There is no Owner's Manual just a CD you must down load when ever you have a question.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Bell

customer_reviews.title: I Can See Why It's Been Discontinued!
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this product. Worked great for 6 months until one day it wouldn't turn on! Now I have to take it to get repaired...luckily it's still under warranty! I expected at least a few years out of this product, especially from Yamaha!
customer_reviews.author: Daron H.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver! Many options. Internet connection and HDMI inputs. Much better imaging than an older Yamaha receiver that I had.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver and Sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great Receiver and Sound. Remote is easy to use. The internet menus however are a bit difficult, but workable. No DLNA video streaming, but not critical, some gapping on audio however. Unable to balance Zone B, but it may be long cables as the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Prize

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd receiver in two weeks, I first ordered a Danon and it was not enough for me. Now I have the Yamaha RX-V575 I am satisfied, it was easy to set up and work. The sound is crisp and has the volume and base I was looking for, it fits the bill for me. I have a 24' by 24' room and it drives 2 Klipch Lascala speakers, plenty enough receiver for me. The TV movie, music and sport channels work well on the surround sound. I think it was a little pricey but remember you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly61

customer_reviews.title: Got this new and on sale for $250. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this new and on sale for $250. It was worth the price compared to some of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Derek V

customer_reviews.title: A good basic receiver that promised more than I am able to get to function
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this receiver as a daily deal so I got a good price on it. However, it has been very difficult to get some of the features to work. I continue to have problems with Zone B and still am unable to get that zone to work. Even though most of the info indicates wireless, the unit doesn't come with wi-fi requiring you to purchase a wi-fi adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Rofagereng

customer_reviews.title: Such a Deal I Got
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to buy this receiver but, the price was scaring me away. Then, I spotted it as the Deal of the Day on Amazon. I got it for $299.99. Great price for a great receiver. I'm still evaluating it but, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: as good as expected from Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: as good as expected from Yamaha. Only I miss one feature from older models like tone control for headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Fede Costa

customer_reviews.title: My old speakers have never sounded this great
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old yamaha amplifier from a few years back; I could not believe what this did to my existing speakers. Very impressed. I also really like the android app to control input and volume. No more searching for remotes, or that the remote could not reach the receiver. My wife is using it directly with Airplay. And I push things to Google chromecast to stream Google Music. I have the chromecast direct connected to the receiver (but still using external power)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver,  Great price, Nice features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Yamaha RX-V575 about three weeks ago and so far I have been very happy with it so far. Also purchased the bluetooth adapter and it has performed flawlessly and was easy to set up. Did not have to purchase the wifi adapter as I had an extra Netgear wireless gaming adapter that I bought two years ago that works with this receiver. My first Yamaha, hopefully better quality than Onkyo, piece of horse dung, that quit working after 15 months. Onkyo customer service sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Kris C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Amazing unit. Easy set up and allowed me to get rid of 10 cables from my old Onkyo receiver. It's made my picture and sound incredible even with a 7 year old Mitsubishi projection TV. Wish it came with the wireless adapter.
customer_reviews.author: JimboAZ

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has not worked since May of 2014. I took the product to the authorized repair dealer and the unit has not worked since the "Repair"
customer_reviews.author: Richard Boyce

customer_reviews.title: I got a defective unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale and the price was really a good deal. However, the unit I got was defective. It wasn't producing the lower frequency sound needed to activate the subwoofers no matter what setup I do. So, I tested the speakers with another receiver and they were all functioning perfectly. I also tried all the possible speaker configurations but to no avail. Maybe it's just a firmware issue that can be easily fixed or it could be something else but I don't think this unit is worth keeping. I'm giving this a one star because it failed the quality and reliability standard I was hoping for a Yamaha product.
customer_reviews.author: D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Rockin' Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This unit was a replacement for a previous Onkyo THX-certified receiver which I enjoyed for a good 10 years. I have a complete Bose 5-speaker/subwoofer configuration so wanted to purchase something that would be of high caliber to work with my new smart TV and the speaker system. I have only had this unit for approximately one week and have not yet been able to explore all its capabilities. The sound is superb and it's even easier to configure than the previous receiver thanks to upgraded technology. Thank you Yamaha for being a sound company that has been around for years and continues to develop quality products.
customer_reviews.author: 108beavnme

customer_reviews.title: So Far, so Good...
customer_reviews.text: This item recently arrived and so far, so good. Set-up was cake, sound is great, and I've had no issues. While many of the negative reviews deal with issues arising over time, I will have to wait to see if anything develops. If they do, I'll be sure to update. However, as of now, I'm loving this system. I have a TV, PS3, ROKU, and a turntable hooked through it thus far. It sends a beautiful picture to the TV and sounds great! I have not tested the zone 2 as I only have 5 speakers and the subwoofer set up, thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A. Weil

customer_reviews.title: Spend you money elsewhere. This felt like a ripoff.
customer_reviews.text: Crap, all crap. Was delivered without the manual so just sat there for weeks till I got it and figured out how to get things set up. Than, after about 8 weeks blew up on me. Avoid this thing at all costs. Just sucks.
customer_reviews.author: The Last Plainsman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought it had blue tooth capabilities not plug your router to it.
customer_reviews.author: robert thomas

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V575 7.2
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and there was a large dent on-top left corner of the receiver. I wired everything, plugged it in and the receiver didn't even turn on. The seller was unethical about the product and its condition.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Singarella Cornett

customer_reviews.title: Airplay doesn't consistently work; Subwoofer has a mind of it's own.
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the 2 stars is one of the main features for me, Airplay, isnt always working. Sometimes it works and sometimes none of my 4 air play devices can pick it up. Also the subwoofer will randomly turn off while watching tv or a movie, and then come back on anywhere from 1 to 10 minutes later, which is annoying and also obviously something it should not do.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Barss

customer_reviews.title: Defective Item
customer_reviews.text: After going through feedback, I bought Yamaha. After couple of weeks, it is not powering on. After research, I noticed the power surge is an issue. I returned this product and ordered for replacement. Keeping my fingers crossed!!
customer_reviews.author: Momtolittleone

product_meta.title: Yamaha RX-V575 7.2-Channel Network AV Receiver with Airplay (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
The RX-V575BL 7.2 channel network AV receiver provides convenient functions including MHL (Mobile High-Definition Link), AirPlay and music streaming services, all controllable through Yamaha's free AV Controller App. Front panel connection and charging for your iPod/iPhone/iPad is provided, as well as wireless capability via optional Wi-Fi or Bluetooth accessories. Zone B output provides 2-channel sound in a second room.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


RX-V575 7.2 CHANNEL NETWORK AV RECEIVER
 * Key Features 
 * 7-channel powerful surround sound
   115 W per channel (8 ohms, 1 kHz, 0.9% THD, 1 ch driven)
   80 W per channel (8 ohms, 20 Hz-20 kHz, 0.09% THD, 2 ch driven)
 * HD Audio format decoding: Dolby® TrueHD and DTS-HD Master Audio™;
   Dolby Digital Plus and DTS-HD High Resolution Audio™
 * Full discrete amp configuration
 * Burr-Brown 192 kHz/24-bit DACs for all channels
 * Direct mode for high quality sound reproduction
 * Low jitter PLL circuitry helps optimize sound imaging
 * Assignable amplifiers for front speaker bi-amp, surround back or Zone B connection
 * FLAC or WAV 192 kHz/24-bit audio playback


EXPERIENCE THE RX-V575 - A POWERFUL 7.2 NETWORK RECEIVER FROM YAMAHA
Seven discrete amplifiers provide versatile speaker options, including 7.2 channel surround, bi-amp to double power to main speakers, or Zone B for extended audio coverage. The Yamaha AV Controller App works with Apple® and Android™ devices and provides simple yet powerful network control. Enjoy your new receiver with CINEMA DSP 3D, which offers an enveloping home theater experience. Expand connectivity with MHL® (Mobile High-Definition Link), AirPlay® and music streaming services. and versatile USB input for iPad® compatibility. With included futuristic technologies like Ultra HD (4K) pass-through and ECO mode, the RX-V575 puts the power in your hands.





TOTAL PURITY CONCEPT FOR THE FINEST SOUND QUALITY
The Total Purity Concept, which Yamaha has been cultivating for many years, encompasses high drive amp technology, high purity pre-amplification, anti-vibration technology and independent pure power supplies. All models have a fully discrete power amplifier that helps to minimize distortion. They also adopt independent pure power supplies, allowing dedicated power supplies for the analog and digital circuitry to prevent digital noise from affecting analog circuitry. The anti-vibration heatsinks are designed to suppress vibration from transistors and sound pressure. Independent power supplies for the DACs are designed to further eliminate noise on certain models. Down to every detail, these AV receivers are designed with full emphasis on the highest possible sound quality.






Click here for a larger imageEXTENSIVE AUDIO CODEC AND FORMAT SUPPORT
This AV receiver is compatible with many audio formats such as Dolby® TrueHD and DTS-HD Master Audio™. They are also compatible with FLAC/WAV 192 kHz playback. You will enjoy excellent Blu-ray Disc™ sound quality and other types of high resolution sources.






DISCRETE AMP CONFIGURATION FOR HIGH SOUND QUALITY
This AV receiver was designed with a strong focus on achieving exceptionally high sound clarity. It employs a discrete amp configuration and a low jitter PLL circuit, which contribute to its excellent audio performance.









Click here for a larger imageULTRA HD (4K) PASS-THROUGH FOR NEXT GENERATION SUPER HIGH RESOLUTION IMAGES
This AV receiver provides advanced HDMI features including Ultra HD (4K) pass-through. Ultra HD (4K) refers to four times the resolution of a 1080p display. While not yet available, Ultra HD (4K) displays and sources are sure to become popular in the future. This receiver is capable of passing the Ultra HD (4K) data from the source to the display for image clarity far beyond present standards.





HDMI® WITH 3D AND AUDIO RETURN CHANNEL
3D means the receiver can handle 3D signal data. The Audio Return Channel function enables data to be sent and received via the same HDMI cable so you can hear the sound from the TV via a single HDMI cable with no need for an extra optical cable.





ZONE B OUTPUT PROVIDES 2-CHANNEL SOUND IN A SECOND ROOM
Zone B output capability allows the receiver to send 2-channel sound to a second zone, so the main zone now has 5-channel output. This means that users can enjoy stereo sound in a second room. The same source will play in both zones (cannot use two sources).





SCENE FOR ONE-TOUCH START
Pressing a SCENE button powers on the AV receiver and selects the input source and DSP mode. You can reset the buttons for different sources by selecting a source and DSP mode then pressing a SCENE button for more than three seconds.







HDMI CEC FOR EASY OPERATION
Another benefit of HDMI is the availability of CEC functionality. When the unit is connected to a CEC compatible TV, it will turn on and off together with the TV and you can use the TV remote to control the volume. CEC also provides advanced functionality with other components. For example, you can use the receiver's remote unit to control player functions like skip and stop.

*All connected devices must be HDMI CEC compatible. Some CEC compatible TVs/players may not work.





Click here for a larger imageNETWORK FUNCTIONS
This AV receiver provides a variety of network functions that enable you to access more sources and also enhance operation. You can connect the receiver to a PC to enjoy Internet radio, Pandora® and operate your system via WebBrowser Control. The AV Controller App (from iTunes App Store or Google Play) lets you control various functions from your iPod, iPhone, iPad or Android devices.






AIRPLAY ALLOWS STREAMING MUSIC TO AV RECEIVER
This AV receiver supports AirPlay, which means they can accept wireless music streaming from iPod® touch, iPhone® or iPad®, as well as from iTunes on Macs or PCs. This makes it easy to enjoy music from your mobile devices or computer on your home theater system. You can use view metadata such as song title, artist name as well as album art* via the AV receiver's on-screen display.

*Some models don't support album art display.








AV CONTROLLER APP FOR EASY, CONVENIENT OPERATION
This AV receiver lets you use the Yamaha AV Controller App that is downloadable from the iTunes App Store or Google Play to control power on/off and volume, select input and DSP modes and operate other functions from an iPhone® or Android devices. You can also use in as many as 23* different languages and customize the interface by hiding unused icons and renaming functions. A tablet version is also available.

*As of Spring 2013.





Click here for a larger imageMHL® (MOBILE HIGH-DEFINITION LINK) SUPPORT FOR HIGH QUALITY VIDEO AND AUDIO
MHL provides easy, direct connection of compatible mobile phones and this AV receiver. Playback of up to 1080p video and multi-channel audio from the phone is supported. The receiver also charges the connected phone. Play, Stop and other basic operations can be controlled from the remote control.







USB DIGITAL CONNECTION FOR IPOD, IPHONE AND IPAD ON THE FRONT PANEL
A USB port on the front panel allows convenient connection of an iPod/iPhone/iPad, which also charges when connected. Because the digital signal from the iPod/iPhone/iPad is transmitted directly to the AV receiver, there is no signal loss or interference, so you enjoy the best possible sound quality. In addition, you can use the receiver's remote control unit to operate the iPod/iPhone/iPad music playback functions.






YPAO™ SOUND OPTIMIZATION FOR AUTOMATIC SPEAKER SETUP
YPAO analyzes the room acoustics and adjusts various audio parameters for optimum sound in just a few minutes. It's like having a professional installer calibrate your system.





INPUT SELECTION IN HDMI STANDBY THROUGH MODE
When the AV receiver is in HDMI Standby Through mode, the input source (Blu-ray Disc™ player, game console, etc.) for viewing on the monitor can be changed via the remote control. There's no need to turn on the AV receiver in order to switch sources.





Click here for a larger imageHD AUDIO WITH CINEMA DSP 3D AND VIRTUAL PRESENCE SPEAKER
CINEMA DSP 3D provides a wide, high and dense sound field. HD Audio format decoding lets you enjoy HD Audio sources. Virtual Presence Speaker delivers 3-dimensional sound without actual use of presence speakers.










COMPRESSED MUSIC ENHANCER
When music is encoded into a digitally compressed format like MP3, the frequency response suffers. Yamaha's Compressed Music Enhancer employs sophisticated digital signal processing using exclusive algorithms to restore what was lost, so the music always sounds the way it should.





ADAPTIVE DRC (DYNAMIC RANGE CONTROL)
Adaptive DRC automatically adjusts the dynamic range of the sound according to the volume level. This ensures that you hear clear dialogue and vocals and all sound effects at comfortable levels. There is no need to adjust the volume level as you listen; everything from whispers to big explosions will be heard clearly and comfortably at the same volume setting. It also tones down loud TV commercials and is ideal for low-volume, late-night listening when you do not want to disturb others.





Click here for a larger imageSUBWOOFER TRIM FOR IMPROVED SOUND IMAGING
The Subwoofer Trim Control enhances the low frequencies by avoiding overlap with the front speaker output. This will result in a cleaner, more focused sound stage while providing a seamless frequency response.








ECO-FRIENDLY DESIGN ECO MODE LOWERS POWER CONSUMPTION BY 20 PERCENT*
Yamaha's new ECO mode reduces power consumption by about 20 percent. It can be set from the top of the GUI menu.

*Compared to power consumption when ECO mode is off (Yamaha measurement).





LOW STANDBY POWER CONSUMPTION
Yamaha makes its receivers eco-friendly with a low standby power consumption of 0.1 W in IR Standby mode (1 W in HDMI Standby Through mode, 2 W in Network Standby mode).









OPTIONAL ACCESSORIES
YWA-10 Wi-Fi Adapter lets you stream music wirelessly via a router from network components such as a PC or NAS.





YBA-11, Bluetooth® Wireless Adapter lets you stream music wirelessly from a Bluetooth-capable smartphone, tablet or PC without a Wi-Fi environment. 










OTHER NOTABLE ADVANCED FEATURES


 * Selectable Auto Power Down
 * Supports Deep Color (30/36 bit), x.v.Color, 24 Hz refresh rate and auto lip-sync compensation
 * SILENT CINEMA™ and Virtual CINEMA DSP
 * Two subwoofer outputs (simultaneous outputs)
 * Charging of iPod®, iPhone® and iPad® via USB when AV receiver is off
 * iPod/iPhone song titles displayed in English and Western European languages on the front panel
 * Multi-language color OSD for improved visibility
 * Audio input assign capability for HDMI and component video input
 * Audio delay for adjusting lip-sync (0-250 ms)
 * 40-station preset tuning / Auto preset tuning
 * Preset remote unit
 * Background video feature (for radio only)
